author: froyop12
title: Very good small set
review: This was a very enjoyable set to build. There was a small parts count but for what was there, it was very solid. The mini figure is very nice. Good prints on both sides. I got this for 3.99 off ebay. There are some other listings for more expensive listings if you want to pick up this polybag. Overall a very pleasant little set for not a lot of money. Definitely pick it up if you can.

author: Speed_champions_fan
title: Another spot-on quad bike!
review:
I think lego city has really been nailing quads lately (if you can ignore a few... exceptions). So when I came across a rack of these for just ONE POUND EACH I just couldn't help myself. Note to all collecters in Ireland: if you want this, it was in toytown in newtownards town square. I only took one. 

Being a polybag, there's no box.

Though this combination of parts produces an exclusive minifig, nothing's exclusive, although the head and torso are new this year.

This is one of the best quad bikes I've seen in lego city. The big tyres make it look low and sleek and the angled bit at the back of the roll cage gives it a sporting flair. There's a single headlight which looks interesting, and the P1 yellow mudflaps are in just two other sets. 

So yes, this is a fairly generic city set, but at only £1 it's irresistible. So, just try to get it. It's a lovely set.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Excellent Addition to Jungle Sub-Theme.
review:
Set #30355 Jungle ATV: Another year another LEGO City Sub-theme, and this one is for the much anticipated LEGO City Jungle. We’ll discuss pros and cons with this polybag review and then give our final thoughts.

Pros:

  • Includes two Machete accessory pieces.

  • Fun little model, pretty impressive looking for the parts used, definitely great for an All-Terrain Vehicle.

  • Jungle Explorer is brand new, and female, cheapest set to include a female Jungle Explorer Minifigure.

Cons:

  • No foliage or animal/insect pieces for the Minifigure to ‘discover’.

  • Model is slightly Juniorized, limited number of parts used in construction, moreso than other Polybags.

Overall opinion

I can’t recommend this set enough, it is a very great value for what you get. Despite not including a single snake, jungle spider or ant for this Explorer to find, the set itself gives us two Machete pieces at a very good price, and features a female character. It is rare to find female Minifigures in Polybags, more often than not LEGO just includes standard male citizens or other characters, this alone makes this set a must have and great not only for presents, but for getting multiple versions of the outfit for MOC figs.
